version_a.description: Fixed version with pool whitelist validation in callback

ground_truth.root_cause: Uniswap V3 swap callback has no validation of msg.sender. Anyone can call the callback pretending to be a pool, triggering token transfers to arbitrary addresses.
ground_truth.attack_vector: Attacker calls uniswapV3SwapCallback directly with crafted parameters, causing the contract to transfer tokens to attacker-controlled recipient without any actual swap occurring.

differential_details.changes_description_a: Added validPools mapping, owner state variable, addValidPool admin function, and require check in callback that msg.sender is in validPools.
differential_details.changes_description_b: No validation of msg.sender in callback, accepts calls from any address.

exact_changes.version_a:
mapping(address => bool) public validPools;
address public owner;
function addValidPool(address pool) external { require(msg.sender == owner, "Not owner"); validPools[pool] = true; }

differential_details.why_this_matters: Pool whitelist ensures only legitimate Uniswap V3 pools can trigger the callback, preventing unauthorized token transfers.
